issue.title: [C++] fixes for PREfast static analyzer
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-15012](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15012). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
this PR resolves most of warnings for MSVC with PREfast

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15012?focusedCommentId=17454816) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Hmm, can you make JIRA issues a bit more informative? It's not obvious what this is talking about. What is "PREfast"?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15012?focusedCommentId=17456095) by Ben Kietzman (bkietz):*
PREfast appears to be a static code analyzer https://www.codeproject.com/Articles/167588/Using-PREfast-for-Static-Code-Analysis

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15012?focusedCommentId=17456250) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Ah... For the record, we tried a Coverity run some years ago but it didn't give many interesting results AFAIR.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15012?focusedCommentId=17456473) by Ben Kietzman (bkietz):*
That's why I'd like to hear from [~rip.nsk@gmail.com] what gains we could expect from using PREfast

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15012?focusedCommentId=17457422) by Renat Valiullin (rip.nsk@gmail.com):*
static analyzer usually does not show much if the project is in good shape, but it can help keep it going.
